abstract: The Federal Reserve said Goldman and JPMorgan would need to resubmit their proposals to pay out billions of dollars to shareholders, citing weaknesses in their capital plans.
snippet: The Federal Reserve said Goldman and JPMorgan would need to resubmit their proposals to pay out billions of dollars to shareholders, citing weaknesses in their capital plans.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase, the Wall Street giants that emerged from the financial crisis in a position of strength, are now facing questions about their ability to withstand future market shocks.

headline.main: Fed Rebukes Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase Over Capital Plans
headline.print_headline: Fed Faults 2 Big Banks Over Plans For Capital
